javadoc:
VersionFileHandler allows a set of VersionFile's to be used in the dynamic reconstruction of an older BufferFile. In an attempt to conserve file handles, only one VersionFile is held open at any point in time.

When constructed, this handler determines the set of VersionFile's needed to reconstruct an older version from a specified target version.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a VersionFile handler.
 VersionFiles will be used to provide original BufferFile data
 for the version origVer.

params.name: targetFileId
params.comment:
file ID of buffer file to which the version file
 buffers will be applied.

throws.comment: if an IO error occurs or data is missing

methods.javadoc: Returns file ID associated with original buffer file.
methods.name: getOriginalFileID
methods.comment: Returns file ID associated with original buffer file.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the list of free indexes associated with the original
 buffer file.
methods.name: getFreeIndexList
methods.comment:
Returns the list of free indexes associated with the original
 buffer file.

methods.name: getOldBuffer
methods.comment:
Get original buffer associated with the specified storage index in the 
 original file.

return.comment: data buffer or null if buffer is not empty and has not been modified

methods.javadoc:
Returns a bit map corresponding to all buffers modified since
 the original version (e.g., oldest).  This identifies all buffers within the target
 version (e.g., latest) which must be reverted to rebuild the original version.
 NOTE: The bit mask may identify buffers which have been removed in the current version.
methods.name: getReverseModMapData
methods.comment:
Returns a bit map corresponding to all buffers modified since
 the original version (e.g., oldest).  This identifies all buffers within the target
 version (e.g., latest) which must be reverted to rebuild the original version.
 NOTE: The bit mask may identify buffers which have been removed in the current version.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a bit map corresponding to all buffers modified since
 the original version (e.g., oldest).  This identifies all buffers contained within the original
 version (e.g., oldest) which have been modified during any revision up until the original version.
 NOTE: The bit mask may identify buffers which have been removed in the current version.
methods.name: getForwardModMapData
methods.comment:
Returns a bit map corresponding to all buffers modified since
 the original version (e.g., oldest).  This identifies all buffers contained within the original
 version (e.g., oldest) which have been modified during any revision up until the original version.
 NOTE: The bit mask may identify buffers which have been removed in the current version.

methods.javadoc: Returns buffer count for original buffer file.
methods.name: getOriginalBufferCount
methods.comment: Returns buffer count for original buffer file.

methods.javadoc: Returns a list of parameters defined within the original beffer file.
methods.name: getOldParameterNames
methods.comment: Returns a list of parameters defined within the original beffer file.

methods.name: getOldParameter
methods.comment: Get a parameter value associated with the original buffer file.

name: VersionFileHandler
comment:
VersionFileHandler allows a set of VersionFile's to be used in
 the dynamic reconstruction of an older BufferFile.  In an attempt to
 conserve file handles, only one VersionFile is held open at any point
 in time.
 
 When constructed, this handler determines the set of VersionFile's needed to 
 reconstruct an older version from a specified target version.
